pullRequest.body:
Also shows that injective on points => separated

partially from the valuation criterion project

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

nodes.body:
### PR summary [186d3a62ae](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18726/commits/186d3a62ae7df5869a0e5a1add636e9f7b50c816)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +7.07% | `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Immersion` |
| +6.71% | `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Immersion | 1768 | 1893 | +125 (+7.07%) |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated | 1773 | 1892 | +119 (+6.71%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Proper` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated`|119|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Immersion`|125|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Scheme.Pullback.diagonalCoverDiagonalRange_eq_top_of_injective`
`+ Scheme.Pullback.range_diagonal_subset_diagonalCoverDiagonalRange`
`+ diagonalCover`
`+ diagonalCoverDiagonalRange`
`+ diagonalCover_map`
`+ diagonalRestrictIsoDiagonal`
`+ instance : IsImmersion (pullback.diagonal f) := by`
`+ isClosedImmersion_diagonal_restrict_diagonalCoverDiagonalRange`
`+ isSeparated_of_injective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Concerning the import bump: IMO this is okay, because
- the files are small so any new import means a big import change
- they are leaf files
- the added imports seem reasonable to me

Also, avoiding this would mean essentially creating a new file for any implication on morphism properties and this is not a scalable approach.

```suggestion
  (openCoverOfBase ùí∞ f f).bind
    fun i ‚Ü¶ openCoverOfLeftRight (ùí± i) (ùí± i) (ùí∞.pullbackHom _ _) (ùí∞.pullbackHom _ _)

/-- The image of `ùí± i j‚ÇÅ √ó_{ùí∞ i} ùí± i j‚ÇÇ` in `diagonalCover` with `j‚ÇÅ = j‚ÇÇ`  -/
noncomputable
def diagonalCoverDiagonal : (pullback.diagonalObj f).Opens :=
  ‚®Ü i : Œ£ i, (ùí± i).J, ((diagonalCover f ùí∞ ùí±).map ‚ü®i.1, i.2, i.2‚ü©).opensRange
```
I don't understand the name `diagonalCoverDiagonal`. Maybe `diagonalCoverDiagonalRange`?
This is the diagonal-portion of the diagonal cover. Yeah maybe `diagonalCoverDiagonalRange` works better.

```suggestion
Given `ùí∞ i` covering `Y` and `ùí± i j` covering `ùí∞ i`, this is the open cover
`ùí± i j‚ÇÅ √ó_{ùí∞ i} ùí± i j‚ÇÇ`  of `X √ó_[Y] X` ranging over all `i`, `j‚ÇÅ`, `j‚ÇÇ`.
```
Ah, we should agree on one convention of informal fibre product notation. Either latex style or lean style. I slightly prefer the `X √ó[Y] Z` version. (this appears below)

```suggestion
  simp_rw [diagonalCover_map, ‚Üê Set.mem_range]
  erw [range_map]
```
I am wondering why this `erw` is necessary. I did not manage to fix it, but I made the observation that it has to be related to the `x ‚àà`, since applying `range_map` without it works with `rw`.
This (and the one below) are removed now.
Do you understand what's going on here?
Glad to see this formalized as I [made it into Stacks](https://github.com/stacks/stacks-project/commit/4b2e2ea9e54c787fafd85df59a0d13a367b3d5d2) :)

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicGeometry): the diagonal map is an immersion
